intro: Lavatera gallica, commonly known as the French lavender or sweet william, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, fluffy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features soft, velvety leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Lavatera gallica thrives in well-drained soil and full sunlight, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its blooming period extends from late spring to early autumn, adding vibrant color to landscapes throughout the growing season.
